channel.title: Server trouble. I have a video. QUICK and NOOBY question. 317 startup error
channel.description:
[b]please help me out, i dont know if this is supposed to happen.
Yes, i did the environment variables thing. I DID NOT do the portforawding step. Cant figure out how. Maybe you guys can give me a better client/source???
Anyways, I have a video showing my quick and nooby problem:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jg17AuDLRSU
Please view my 47 second problem and tell me if it is normal or not.
The problem in the video is that I click runserver in the server folder, and command prompt quickly pops up, pops away. all in about half a second. PLEASE HELP ME![/b]

item.title: Server trouble. I have a video. QUICK and NOOBY question. 317 startup error
item.dc:creator: @andrew894 andrew894
item.description:
@andrew894 wrote:

as stated before… for a first time hoster use utorrent. and you should run the server before opening the client. also if your the hoster trying to connect to ur server u have to change the ip in the client folder at client.java to 127.0.0.1 and in the server folder at server.java http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gAFDbwfqUf4 for how to portforward with utorrent. hope i helped

Read full topic
item.source: Server trouble. I have a video. QUICK and NOOBY question. 317 startup error

item.title: Server trouble. I have a video. QUICK and NOOBY question. 317 startup error
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

As unholy said (HI UNHOLY), you should use uTorrrent to portforward. It took me less than 45 seconds to do it, and it works very fine. If you are unsure if you have portforwarded, you may confirm at http://canyouseeme.org In the box, put in 43594 (or 5555 if you forwarded that) and it should tell you whatsoever.

Read full topic

you don’t need a better source/client.
Use what you like the best.
